task_summary: A robot arm perceives, grasps a canned spam, and transfers it to the sink.

task_long_description.overview: This episode tasks a robot arm with picking up a canned spam from a countertop and dropping or placing it in the sink basin. The robot must visually locate the spam can, approach from the side for a stable grasp, transport the can above the sink, and release it. The scene is a toy kitchen with structured objects (cabinet, sink, faucet, utensils) and minimal clutter. The activity must avoid collisions and ensure the can lands in the sink area.
preconditions: Spam can placed upright on counter within arm reach.
Sink is empty and accessible; gripper is empty.
No unexpected obstacles between can, arm, and sink.
stepwise_plan: Open gripper and approach can from above.
Lower until contact and close gripper.
Place at goal pose above sink and open gripper.
success_criteria: Spam can is located and picked up by the gripper.
Can is deposited within the boundary of the sink.
No drops, collisions, or object left outside sink.
failure_and_recovery: Failed grasp: retry approach and grasp.
Sink not detected: scan or retry detection.
Collision or misplacement: abort and alert.
task_long_description.termination: Task ends when the can is released above the sink and gripper is clear.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: Put the canned spam into the sink

node_specs.description: Checks if the spam can is visible to the robot.
Performs a grid scan to locate the spam can.
Performs object detection for the spam can.
Opens the gripper to the appropriate width.
Moves the gripper above the spam can.
Computes side grasp pose for the spam can and stores it.
Approaches and aligns to the computed grasp pose.
Lowers gripper until contact with the can is detected.
Closes gripper to grasp the can with moderate force.
Checks if the grasp is stable.
Checks if the sink is visible to the robot.
Performs object detection for the sink.
Moves the gripper above the sink.
Places the can at the goal pose above the sink.
Opens the gripper to release the can.
Retracts the gripper from the sink.
Waits briefly to ensure task completion.

failure_modes: Grasp not stable or object slips.
Release unsuccessful (object not dropped in sink).
recovery_strategy: Retry object/sink scanning up to 3 times.
Abort and alert upon repeated failures.
assumptions: Instruction does not specify grasp type; side-grasp inferred from frames 2–4.
Object for transfer is visually matched to spam can in all frames.
Sink is unobstructed; detected via visual features.
PlaceAt pose set to 'goal_pose' for generalization—actual sink location is physically verified in the scene.

expected_success_criteria: Spam can is no longer on counter, instead inside sink at episode end.
